content:
OmniScripts Currency Element

Enable users to enter a currency amount by adding the Currency element to your OmniScript. Update default format options such as the number of decimal places to display, minimum and maximum currency value, and more.

Drag a Currency element from the Build panel onto the canvas.
In the Properties panel, give the element a name in the Name field.
In Field Label, enter a label visible to the user.

To override the default allowable format, select Custom Mask and enter a new mask in the Format Override: Custom Mask field. See JavaScript Number Formatter.
Configure other properties as needed:
In Format Override: Decimal Places, enter a number to change the default number of decimal places to display.
In Minimum Currency Value, enter the minimum value that a user can enter.
In Maximum Currency Value, enter the maximum value that a user can enter.
Select Allow Negative Numbers to allow users to enter negative values.
Select Hide Comma Separators to hide commas for values greater than three digits.
Select Display Currency Code to display a currency code based on the logged-in user's locale.

For additional properties, see Common OmniScript Element Properties Definitions.
title: OmniScripts Currency Element Properties and Configuration
